Account.description: Generic Account structure used to define commonalities between sub concepts of PartyAccount and Financial Account.

accountType.title: A categorization of an account, such as individual, joint, and so forth, whose instances share some of the same characteristics. Note: for flexibility we use a String here but an implementation may use an enumeration with a limited list of valid values.

description.title: Detailed description of the party account

lastModified.title: Date of last modification of the account

state.title: Contains the lifecycle state such as: Active, Closed, Suspended and so on.

allOf.title: The maximum amount of money that may be charged on an account

AccumulatedBalance.description: Represents and tracks the aggregated amount remained or owed in certain account which is owned by certain customer for a set of buckets.

@baseType.title: When sub-classing, this defines the super-class

@schemaLocation.title: A URI to a JSON-Schema file that defines additional attributes and relationships

description.title: Text describing the contents of the aggregated balance

name.title: Friendly name to identify the aggregated balance

bucket.title: A reference to the buckets involved in the aggregation

allOf.title: A reference to the logical resource that can be used to identify the bucket balance for example where product ids are not unique.
A reference to the account that owns the buckets aggregated

product.title: A reference to the product whose consumption is managed by the bucket . This is an array to allow scenarios where a buckets are shared between different products

relatedParty.title: Used to provide information about any other entity with relation to the balance, for instance to define customer hierarchy for the balance (e.g.: customerId, userId, )

allOf.title: Aggregated for a set of prepay balance buckets associated to the product

defines the type of the underlying Balance eg data,voice, any currency eg EUR, USD etc

AgreementRef.description: Agreement reference. An agreement represents a contract or arrangement, either written or verbal and sometimes enforceable by law, such as a service level agreement or a customer price agreement. An agreement involves a number of other business entities, such as products, services, and resources and/or their specifications.

BalanceActionHistory.description: A history of the following operations performed on the bucket: TopupBalance, AdjustBalance and TransferBalance

@baseType.title: When sub-classing, this defines the super-class

@schemaLocation.title: A URI to a JSON-Schema file that defines additional attributes and relationships

confirmationDate.title: Date when the deduction was confirmed in the server

isAutoTopup.title: Indicates if the topup requested is an autotopup (to be processed periodically)

numberOfPeriods.title: For autotopup indicates the number of occurrences of the period the recharge operation must be executed. If not included then no limit is set to stop the executionof the topup every period

reason.title: Text describing the reason for the action/task

requestedDate.title: Date when the deduction request was received in the server

voucher.title: Identifier for a voucher when the topup can be performed by this means

allOf.title: valid values are RecurringCharge or OneTimeCharge
Indicate the amount on the bucket
A reference to the bucket impacted by the request or the value itself.
Indicator for the channel used to request the transfer operation. Structure including at least attribute name
Indicates which related party will bear the costs of the transfer
A reference to the account that owns the bucket impacted by the balance related operation

Payment method used for the recharge operation (e.g.: cash, credit card). Structure including at least attribute dname. Notice that the use of a voucher can be managed as a specific methodtype, where he voucher code can be passed as value.

Identifier for the user/customer/entity that receives the transfer when it is required to indicate additional customer hierarchy information regarding the entity receiving the balance transfer Structure including at least attributes role and name.
A reference to the bucket to which the balance will be transferred
Type of prepay balance bucket (e.g.: roaming-data, data, roaming-voice etc)
A reference to the logical resource that can be used to identify the bucket balance for example where product ids are not unique.
For autotopup indicates the periodicity for the recharge operation (monthly, weekly, )

Status of the operation
Associated cost to be charged for the transfer operation (can be monetary or non-monetary)
defines the type of the underlying Balance eg data,voice, any currency eg EUR, USD etc
The period for which the balance in the bucket is valid

BankAccountDebit.description: A bank account debit method of payment. This could be extended to add any required authorization fields to allow recurring payments

@baseType.title: When sub-classing, this defines the super-class

@schemaLocation.title: A URI to a JSON-Schema file that defines additional attributes and relationships

name.title: Friendly name assigned to the payment method

description.title: Text description of the contents of the payment method

isPreferred.title: If the method is the preferred one by the owner. Typically used when querying for the payment methods of a specific customer or account

authorizationCode.title: Review: Authorization code provided by a financial institution. Typically this would be populated for recurring payments using the method, as payments have an authorization code of their own.

statusDate.title: The last time the payment method status changed.

statusReason.title: The reason for the last status change.

allOf.title: Date interval in which the payment method is valid
Type of payment method (e.g.: bank card, cash, voucher). The details field type depends on the value assigned to this one.
Reference to the customer or party that owns that payment method or can use it.
Reference to a place for billing or delivery address, if different to that of the related party.

account.title: Reference to the accounts that are linked to the payment method. May be a party account or a financial account.

accountNumber.title: The Bank Account Number (this could refer to the IBAN or SWIFT number)

accountNumberType.title: The type of account number (e.g.: IBAN, SWIFT, ...)

BIC.title: The Business Identifier Code/Swift code of the financial institution where the account is located.

owner.title: The owner of the bank account. This is also the account name.

bank.title: The display name of the bank.

@baseType.title: When sub-classing, this defines the super-class

@schemaLocation.title: A URI to a JSON-Schema file that defines additional attributes and relationships

billingDateShift.title: An offset of a billing/settlement date. The offset is expressed as number of days with regard to the start of the billing/settlement period.

billingPeriod.title: A billing time period. It can be recurring, for example: week, month, quarter of year, year .

chargeDateOffset.title: An offset of a date through which charges previously received by the billing system will appear on the bill. The offset is expressed as number of days with regard to the start of the BillingPeriod.

creditDateOffset.title: An offset of a date through which credits previously received by the billing system will appear on the bill. The offset is expressed as number of days with regard to the start of the BillingPeriod.

frequency.title: Frequency of the billing cycle (monthly for instance)

mailingDateOffset.title: An offset of a customer bill mailing date. The offset is expressed as number of days with regard to the start of the BillingPeriod.

paymentDueDateOffset.title: An offset of a payment due date. The offset is expressed as number of days with regard to the start of the BillingPeriod.

allOf.title: The period for which the billing specification cycle is valid

TaxExemptionCertificate.description: A tax exemption certificate represents a tax exemption granted to a party (individual or organization) by a tax jurisdiction which may be a city, state, country. An exemption has a certificate identifier (received from the jurisdiction that levied the tax) and a validity period.
